ObjectName: Agenda de bufete o libro de memoria diario para 1884 con noticia
Caption-Abstract:
Note on t.p. from W.E. Retana, dated August 1903 in Madrid, describing provenance of diary: "Libro de memorias del Dr. JosÃ© Rizal. DespueÅ de ser fusilado, pasÃ³ Ã¡ manos del Sr. Clemente J. Zulueta, filipino, de quien lo adquirÃ­."
Catalogue description bearing ownership stamp of the CompaÃ±Ã­a General de Tabacos de Filipinas affixed to inside front cover.
Affixed to p. 67: brief note to Rizal from his friend [Eduardo de] Lete.
Laid in, p. 137: note dated Aug. 3, 1888 in San JosÃ©, Frozo?, to Mariano Herbosa (Hervosa), Rizal's brother-in-law, in Calamba, Rizal's hometown. The author of the note, H[?] E[?], (signature illegible), is seeking a decision on a business matter involving certain parcels of land. Verso contains handwritten death notice for Hervosa, who was born Sept. 8, 1851, and who died May 24, 1889, leaving a widow (Rizal's sister Lucia) and children.
Published in Vida y escritos del Dr. JosÃ© Rizal / W.E. Retana. Madrid, 1907, p. 72-91.
Forms part of the Edward E. Ayer Manuscript Collection (Newberry Library)
Original binding and loose signatures in two separate 4-flaps, which have been placed in a brown cloth-covered drop spine box.
Accompanied by a preservation photocopy of the original diary and laid-in note in a brown cloth binding.
Original diary in drop spine box, and bound preservation photocopy have been placed into a book shoe.

element_texts.text:
Enero de 1884.
(1-365) 1 Martes. La Ciruncision DEL SEñOR.
Tengo el valor nominal ...
anoche ___ vennimos en el Rect de ella drid??
tres Paternos , dos _____ , Viguerva, Villanneva
Jugo, lyroceiano J. Llorento, Sr. Aguirre, Laner
ma, lete Ventura  Triante, Vidal y yo. todos brindamos menos Villanneva que salio antes. Los brindis que mas le distingueieron (fuera)  los de Laserna.
A. Paterno, Graciano Lopez, P.Paterno con Valentin __.
mi ___ cuerpo el ___ de despedir al 83 y la- ___ al  __
brinde pero  despues ___ el __ de __ brillante s dijeron . Lete Reyo tan precioso ______
mas a los tres

element_texts.text:
Enero.
(21-315) 21 Lunes. Sta. Ines, vg. y mr.
Un periodico.
Fui a clase: la de Derecho de niegen a entrar en clase mientras no deroguen les decreto, Lete vino a darme l_s gra_a,  en nombre de L.V.
en la noche estuvo Estevan hablamos de varias.
_____ le dio
P. Palerno dio un convite a cena a la prensa. Valentin tentura avistio
(22-311) 22 Martes. S. Vicente, diac.
Lavandera
Sello para el interior.
Braulio Leon-Garcia

Note on t.p. from W.E. Retana, dated August 1903 in Madrid, describing provenance of diary: "Libro de memorias del Dr. JosÃ© Rizal. DespueÅ de ser fusilado, pasÃ³ Ã¡ manos del Sr. Clemente J. Zulueta, filipino, de quien lo adquirÃ­."
Catalogue description bearing ownership stamp of the CompaÃ±Ã­a General de Tabacos de Filipinas affixed to inside front cover.
Affixed to p. 67: brief note to Rizal from his friend [Eduardo de] Lete.
Laid in, p. 137: note dated Aug. 3, 1888 in San JosÃ©, Frozo?, to Mariano Herbosa (Hervosa), Rizal's brother-in-law, in Calamba, Rizal's hometown. The author of the note, H[?] E[?], (signature illegible), is seeking a decision on a business matter involving certain parcels of land. Verso contains handwritten death notice for Hervosa, who was born Sept. 8, 1851, and who died May 24, 1889, leaving a widow (Rizal's sister Lucia) and children.
Published in Vida y escritos del Dr. JosÃ© Rizal / W.E. Retana. Madrid, 1907, p. 72-91.
Forms part of the Edward E. Ayer Manuscript Collection (Newberry Library)
Original binding and loose signatures in two separate 4-flaps, which have been placed in a brown cloth-covered drop spine box.
Accompanied by a preservation photocopy of the original diary and laid-in note in a brown cloth binding.
Original diary in drop spine box, and bound preservation photocopy have been placed into a book shoe.

Note on t.p. from W.E. Retana, dated August 1903 in Madrid, describing provenance of diary: "Libro de memorias del Dr. JosÃ© Rizal. DespueÅ de ser fusilado, pasÃ³ Ã¡ manos del Sr. Clemente J. Zulueta, filipino, de quien lo adquirÃ­."
Catalogue description bearing ownership stamp of the CompaÃ±Ã­a General de Tabacos de Filipinas affixed to inside front cover.
Affixed to p. 67: brief note to Rizal from his friend [Eduardo de] Lete.
Laid in, p. 137: note dated Aug. 3, 1888 in San JosÃ©, Frozo?, to Mariano Herbosa (Hervosa), Rizal's brother-in-law, in Calamba, Rizal's hometown. The author of the note, H[?] E[?], (signature illegible), is seeking a decision on a business matter involving certain parcels of land. Verso contains handwritten death notice for Hervosa, who was born Sept. 8, 1851, and who died May 24, 1889, leaving a widow (Rizal's sister Lucia) and children.
Published in Vida y escritos del Dr. JosÃ© Rizal / W.E. Retana. Madrid, 1907, p. 72-91.
Forms part of the Edward E. Ayer Manuscript Collection (Newberry Library)
Original binding and loose signatures in two separate 4-flaps, which have been placed in a brown cloth-covered drop spine box.
Accompanied by a preservation photocopy of the original diary and laid-in note in a brown cloth binding.
Original diary in drop spine box, and bound preservation photocopy have been placed into a book shoe.
